tweet: A little small for us, but we'll take a look

$PTI claims its "amplifier" drug for CF improves lung function, but patients on the drug barely improved on average; they only looked good in comparison with an anomalously bad placebo group. A normal placebo group would reveal that the drug is ineffective (2/5)

The KODAKOne team has zero credibility. AppCoin head has checkered, stock promoter past & prior securities law violations. WENN Digital team unknown, unproven. And $KODK board members awarded shares to themselves day before announcement -- could be an SEC violation (4/5)

Cryptographically hashing an image into a blockchain doesn’t prove the provenance of intellectual property, a blockchain does not reduce the resources necessary for copyright enforcement, no photographer would rather be paid in KODAKCoins over real money. (3/5)
KODAKOne and KODAKCoin are PR stunts. A cryptocurrency for image rights licensing makes no sense. Blockchain cannot fix the problem of IP ownership and does nothing for enforcement. (2/5)
Crypto. We haven't come across a theme this big since the Chinese frauds. First report coming tomorrow – blockchain fever won't save this company from bankruptcy.

The auto vertical ($LXFT’s 2nd largest now at 18% of revenue) grew 76% y-o-y on strength of autonomous driving. OEMs will continue to rely on high-end vendors like $LXFT. Company is a long term growth story worth $100+. Developers, developers, developers! (2/2)

$LXFT reported strongs s, shares up 14%. Updated report at   Revenue growth of 38% excluding DB/UBS. Despite fear that DB/UBS would fall further, sales from DB/UBS increased sequentially 14% and 7%. Businesses outside of top 5 grew >40% (1/2)

$VSAT reported another weak quarter last night. Revenue fell -3% y/y, EBITDA -34%. Subs declined -14% y/y, -6% q/q to 589k. Mgmt said Dec qtr would return to sub growth, on ccall revised Dec to be neg again.   How low will subs ultimately go?

PRX002 also showed no positive trend in Ph. 1b despite shotgun approach to endpoints, Ph. 2 is merely longer Ph. 1b & will be no different. We will publish separate report on PRX002. Reasons it does not work likely same as why amyloid-beta mAbs for Alzheimer’s failed $PRTA

Ph. 1/2 results for NEOD001 missing all elements of efficacy — no actual clinical response, no dose response, no improvement over time. Amyloid researchers believe it will fail; coinventors of NEOD001 predecessor & others told us “almost zero” prob of clinical success $PRTA
$ADMS is also a tempting M&A target for other pharma co's. Cutting redundant SG&A & accelerating the sales ramp would deliver add'l upside.
$SAGE SRSE results should be out soon
We'll subscribe if you cover my next biotech short. Deal?
$VSAT: With Mark attending, we expect majority of top 10 holders (excluding index funds) to join Thurs event. Should be a spirited debate
For an event like this - which will likely attract major holders now given the presence of the CEO - debate will be private & confidential
Arguments that disprove our thesis would make us rethink the short. With years of mgmt call, event transcripts, we think we know his views
$VSAT CEO coming to Thursday's investor dinner to debate us. Kudos to Mark Dankberg, he'll be first in short activism history to do so
$VSAT: We've launched   where we'll keep an ongoing FAQ and post more detailed follow-ups on specific topics
I sense sarcasm. Why don't we talk through the arguments for an hr. It'll be clear pretty quick who's done the work. What are you afraid of?
And our $DISH target px was $20, so you can make that red band for DISH just as long as the green one :)
Sat internet imposes data caps on customers. As streaming booms, all subs will migrate to providers with no caps. $VSAT's $5B EV will vanish
$VSAT is free cash flow negative every yr from 2009 to 2022+, constantly re-investing in a biz that will go extinct by 2023

We'll publish on a new short tomorrow. Entranced by a billionaire investor, investors haven't done their homework on this one.

$NAK's response effectively admits that Pebble personnel DID conclude costs would be uneconomically high. See also:

$NAK deposit may be big, but it's low-grade. Requires yuge amounts of costly infrastructure. Awful ROI, not EPA, scared away past partners
We're short $NAK, report:   Trump may rescind EPA veto but $NAK still worth $0 b/c its mine isn't commercially viable

$STRP: Files shelf reg, preps for equity offering, stock -6%. It makes sense: Co. can make far more $$ selling stock than selling spectrum
Since everyone liked our morning poll so much, here's the next one. Will $STRP sell itself for $500m+?
High-freq bands still unlikely to be very valuable. Lot of supply; commercial viability many yrs away; will be very costly to deploy 3/5
